description.value:
>@UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.themes.Item.5asY5v0woPeqEvu7]{Cult Hunter}

The process of deprogramming a cult member is long and arduous, but you’ve learned tricks to grant a moment of lucidity to even the most entrenched members. When attempting a @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.JournalEntry.GMkLZsN3a7YPvA03.JournalEntryPage.1tzIBDaDAO4hmX5C]{Diplomacy} check to @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.JournalEntry.GMkLZsN3a7YPvA03.JournalEntryPage.1tzIBDaDAO4hmX5C#change-attitude]{change a creature’s attitude}, you can spend 1 Resolve Point to do so as a standard action rather than taking a full minute. In addition, when you use this ability on a creature under the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.JournalEntry.PqV3OCbUTyk2upPD.JournalEntryPage.Et5Wi1ityPgChozU#charm]{charm} or @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.JournalEntry.PqV3OCbUTyk2upPD.JournalEntryPage.Et5Wi1ityPgChozU#compulsion]{compulsion} effect whose save DC is lower than the result of your Diplomacy check, that effect is suppressed for 1 minute. The effects of this ability are temporary, but repeated applications could help a cult member begin a journey along the road to recovery.
